content.description:
Some slippery friction moves climb up and left leading to an overlap. Getting past the small overlap is a bit tricky. Continue up very easy low angle climbing to the top after the mantle. 

  Maybe a bit less memorable than some of the other climbs but worth doing of course.
content.location: The farthest left climb on the east wall.

content.description: At the grade the beginning can be a little frustrating since the hardest moves are only a few feet off the ground. Once you figure out how to do it however, it's not too bad. All of the challenge is in the first 1/3 of the climb including a really neat sequence past an undercling.
content.location: Right in the middle of the cliff. Starts just left of a couple of trees.

content.description:
This is the right most route and the easiest in the East Wall. mostly smooth, lightly featured slab with some edges thrown in.  

  Smooth sailing for the most part with a route-finding crux at the last bolt. 

  A perfect beginner lead.

Another great beginner route. Another reason this is a beginning leader's paradise. 

  Climb a ribbed slab staying just right of the corner, some will grab it others might just friction past. Get into easier climbing cutting to the right around some vegetation gaining a ledge and the anchors which are set beck farther than Mild Horses anchor.
content.location: 2nd route from the right. Climbs just right of a good sized broken corner and cuts right of some vegetation.

content.description: Two challenging sections separated by easier climbing. Nice easy start up to an intimidating looking blankish slab. Don't worry, there are holds you just need to figure out how to get to them. The roof section that poses the next challenge involves a traverse left to get to the best mantle spot. Pull the mantle with relative difficulty and romp on to the top.
content.location: 3rd route from the left. Through the most intimidating part of the overlap.

content.description: Climb through a well bolted low crux that climbs through a notch in an intimidating looking broken overlap. The climbing is just plain fun so don't be spooked by the rock or the bad ass name. Once through the steep beginning climb easy slab to a ledge and the anchor.
content.location: 3rd route from the right. Starts through a cool broken overlap section just right of some trees.

content.description:
Another left leaning slab section leading to an overlap. This one has a pretty easy start but leads to a harder overlap than it's neighbor to the left IMO. Also IMO, if you only have time for one, do this one. 

  the crux is definitely easier the more time you take to figure out what you have to work with and how you can utilize it.
This is the obvious slab wall facing you as you walk in to the Corral Area. Very smooth sections are punctuated by edges, cracks and small roofs. Really fun moderate climbing right down the line.
